availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert DePriest Salmons (Simpson County, Kentucky, merchant and railroad agent)

body.p: Simpson County, Kentucky, merchant and railroad agent. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth K. Salmons. Father of Allison Salmons, John W. Salmons, James F. Salmons, Mary F. Salmons, Rebecca Salmons, Bert Salmons, Joel Salmons, and Elizabeth Salmons. Merchant in Simpson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1850. Railroad agent in Simpson County in 1860. Owned nineteen enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 10B-11A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 848.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, Franklin, p. 142.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, Franklin, p. 309A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, Franklin, p. 9B.
Find A Grave, "Col. Robert DePriest Salmons (6 May 1815-1 Jan 1885)," Memorial #21561854, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/21561854 (accessed August 25, 2020).
